definitions: market or charge for (items or services) separately rather than as part of a package

examples.text: banks may be forced to unbundle costs and charge extra for each check processed
all systems are now sold unbundled

shortDefinitions: charge for items or services separately rather than as package

definitions: split (a company or conglomerate) into its constituent businesses, especially before selling them off

examples.text: the company's decision to unbundle its retail holdings comes at a bad time
the unbundling practised by leveraged buyout specialists in the 1980s

shortDefinitions: split company or conglomerate into its constituent businesses
